Description: The Department of Justice reached 70 settlements involving 457 hospitals in 43 states for more than $250 million related to cardiac devices that were implanted in Medicare patients in violation of Medicare coverage requirements.
Three San Antonio, Texas affiliates of Christus Health of Houston paid the United States $1.36 million to settle claims that they defrauded Medicare and Medicaid from 1997 through 2000.

CHRISTUS Health Gulf Coast, owner and operator of CHRISTUS St. Joseph Hospital, of Houston, Texas, agreed to pay $220,000 to settle claims that the hospital defrauded the Medicare Program from April 1997 to June 2000.

Primary Offense: Medicare Parts C and D Enforcement Action

Agency: Office of Federal Contract Compliance Programs
Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Company: CHRISTUS Spohn Hospital Corpus Christi - Shoreline
Description: back pay award in unfair labor practices case

Extracted from a download of OSHA's Enforcment Data downloaded on 3/02/2022, available at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_catalogs.php

Company: CHRISTUS St. Vincent Regional Medical Center
Description: CHRISTUS St. Vincent Regional Medical Center and its partner CHRISTUS Health agreed to resolve allegations that they violated the False Claims Act by making illegal donations to county governments, which were used to fund the state share of Medicaid payments to the hospital.

Info Source: Texas Workers' Comp January Enforcements Include Fines Up to $68K, Insurance Journal, February 15, 2011 (via Nexis).

Description: CHRISTUS agreed to pay $225,000 in settlement of alleged violations discovered in a triennial quality of care examination conducted by the Department of Insurance.
